member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.DenavitHartenbergParameters
member.summary: The Denavit-Hartenberg parameters (also called DH parameters) are the four parameters associated with a particular convention for attaching reference frames to the links of a spatial kinematic chain, or robot manipulator.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.DenavitHartenbergParameters.D
member.summary: Offset along previous z to the common normal.
member.remarks: Also known as Offset.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.DenavitHartenbergParameters.Theta
member.summary: Angle about previous z, from old x to new x.
member.remarks: Also known as Rotation.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.DenavitHartenbergParameters.A
member.summary: Length of the common normal. Assuming a revolute joint, this is the radius about previous z.
member.remarks: Also kown as Length and r.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.DenavitHartenbergParameters.Alpha
member.summary: Angle about common normal, from old z axis to new z axis.
member.remarks: Also known as Twist.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.DenavitHartenbergParameters.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DenavitHartenbergParameters struct using specified parameter values.
member.param: Offset along previous z to the common normal.
Angle about previous z, from old x to new x.
Length of the common normal. Assuming a revolute joint, this is the radius about previous z.
Angle about common normal, from old z axis to new z axis.

member.summary: Maximum lifetime of particles (in seconds)

member.summary: Amount to randomize the initial size of particles.

member.summary: Color of particles.
member.remarks: Initial opacity of particles is derived from the A (alpha) property.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.ParticleSystemData.OpacityRate
member.summary: Rate of change of the opacity of particles (per second)
member.remarks: Set to a negative value to fade out particles. Opacity ranges from 1.0 to 0.0

member.summary: Creates one or more bodies that consisting of one single wire each. The source wires that are connected will be joined and separate wires will result in new wire bodies.

member.param: The array of objects that shall be joined.
member.returns: The array of new wire bodies.

member.param: The array of objects that shall be joined.
The largest distance between vertices that are considered coincident.
member.returns: The array of new wire bodies.

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.BrushColorCollection
member.summary: For ABB Internal use only. Backward compatibility between versions is not guaranteed. A collection of colors used when rendering a PaintL, PaintC and SetBrush instructions. Those RAPID instructions are part of RobotWare Paint. The SetBrush instruction references a brush number and this collection provides the mapping from brush number to color representation in RobotStudio.
member.remarks: This collection has nothing to do with the color a paint robot is painting with, when executing its program. The colors in this collection are only used to visualize, in the robotStudio graphics, where different brushes are used.

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.ConfigurationData
member.summary: Represents information about the robot arm configuration, to be used when reaching a target. Given a tool and a target is is usually possible for the robot to reach it using different set of axes angles. This structure has a corresponding RAPID data type called confdata. The is used to unambigously denote one of a set of possible robot arm configurations. It is done by specifying in which quadrant, four of the robot axes, should be in. It is not necessecary to specify this value for all axes. Depending on the robot model, the axes used to denote configuration, and the interpretation of the configuration can vary. Please refer to the RAPID Reference Manual.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.ConfigurationData.Cf1
member.summary: The quadrant of axis 1.
member.value: An integer specifying the quadrant of axis 1.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.ConfigurationData.Cf4
member.summary: The quadrant of axis 4.
member.value: An integer specifying the quadrant of axis 4.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.ConfigurationData.Cf6
member.summary: The quadrant of axis 6.
member.value: An integer specifying the quadrant of axis 6.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.ConfigurationData.Cfx
member.summary: The quadrant of an axis that is not axis 1,4 or 6. Its usage depends on the robot model. For many robot models this value is not used.
member.value: An integer specifying the quadrant of an axis that is not axis 1,4 or 6. Its usage depends on the robot model. For many robot models this value us not used. Please refer to the RAPID documentation.

member.remarks: The length of values must be 4.
member.exception: When size of values are not 4.

member.summary: Returns the axis quadrants as an array of integers.
member.returns: An array of integer containing four elements which specifies the four axis quadrants.

member.summary: Specifies the RAPID storage type of a . Please refer to the RAPID reference manual for more information.
member.remarks: This enumeration is used to express compile time information about a RAPID data declaration. For example a with its set to Constant is possible to modify in RobotStudio. So it is not considered constant in the station. Only at runtime in the controller.

member.summary: Virtual time is controlled by the simulation engine. Virtual controllers will be stepped forward one 'slice' of time for each simulation step.
member.remarks: This mode will cause the virtual controller to be unresponsive for example when the simulation is paused.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.ExternalAxisValues.SetAxisValues(ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.ExternalAxisValues@,System.Double[],System.Int32[])
member.summary: Sets only the values of the active external axes. One array contains the values for the active axes, and another arrays specifies the positions in the , where the values will be set. A RAPID robtarget specifies the axis positions for six robot axes and six external axes. More than 6 external axes can be controlled, but not simultaneously. Behind the scenes, all the axes position values are treated as an array of length 12. The first six elements contains the position values for the robot axes, and the last six, contains the position values for the external axes. Please refer to for more information about logical axis, and activation/deactivation of external axes. It is common that none, or only a few of the external axes are used. If for example two axes are used, the two array parameters shall have the lenght two.
member.param: The which values shall be set. Which axes (Eax_1 - Eax_6), that will be affected depends on the logicalAxis
An array of double that contains the values to set.
An array of integers that specifies in which positions (Eax_1 to Eax_6) the values shall be set.
member.exception: The different reasons are: The axisValue is not of the same length as the logicalAxis array. The arrays have a length that is not between 1 and 6. The values in the logicalAxis array are not in the range 7 to 12.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.ExternalAxisValues.SetAxisValues(ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.ExternalAxisValues@,System.Double[])
member.summary: Sets the values of the specified , given the specified array of doubles.
member.exception: The axisValue array is not of length 6.
member.remarks: The length of axisValues must be 6.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.ExternalAxisValues.GetAxisValues(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Returns the axes values for the active external axes in Eax_1 to Eax_6 as an array.
member.param: An array of integers that specifies for the positions (Eax_1 to Eax_6) to get the values for.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.ExternalAxisValues.GetAxisValues
member.summary: Returns the external axes values in Eax_1 to Eax_6 as an array.

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Face
member.summary: A face is a bounded portion of a single geometric surface, the two-dimensional analog of a body. The boundary is represented by one or more loops or edges. Each face is simply connected, implying that one can traverse from any point on the interior of the face to any other point on the interior of the face without crossing the boundary of the face. In general, it is not meaningful to distinguish exterior and interior loops of edges, though for certain surface types this may be possible and some algorithms may do so.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Face.ReverseNormal
member.summary: Reverses the sense of a face; i.e., makes the face material void (flips the normal). Also, alters the senses of the coedges to avoid changing the shape of the face.
member.returns: True if successful.
member.remarks: This method does not check to see if the face belongs to a solid, nor does it compensate for side effects caused by reversal of the face. The user must ensure that this method is called only for independent faces.

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Flange
member.summary: Represents a flange of a . A flange is an entity that is created when modeling a mechanism. Using the flange you can attach other objects deriving from to the link of the flange. A robot usually has a flange modeled at its wrist. That makes it possible to for example attach a tool on the wrist of a robot.

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.InformationStream
member.summary: Provides access to the Information Stream of the Virtual Controller. Currently only I/O signals are supported. The Information Stream is synchronized with Virtual Time, so you can use it together with the object in order to react on signal value changes during a simulation. Each change event is stamped with the virtual time when it occured.

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.KnownAttributeKey
member.summary: Contains attribute keys for use in the DynamicProperty.Attributes collection. Attributes with these keys are used for value validation and user interface hints.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.KnownAttributeKey.MinValue
member.summary: Indicates the minium value for a numeric property. Value must be a number.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.KnownAttributeKey.MaxValue
member.summary: Indicates the maximum value for a numeric property. Value must be a number.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.KnownAttributeKey.AllowedValues
member.summary: Indicates the allowed values for a numeric or string property. Value must be a list delimited by semicolons.
member.remarks: Properties with this attribute set will be displayed as a dropdown.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.KnownAttributeKey.MinLength
member.summary: Indicates the minimum length of a string property. Value must be an integer.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.KnownAttributeKey.MaxLength
member.summary: Indicates the maximum length of a string property. Value must be an integer.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.KnownAttributeKey.AllowedCharacters
member.summary: Indicates the allowed characters in a string property.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.KnownAttributeKey.CustomValidation
member.summary: Indicates that QueryPropertyValueValid() should be called to validate the value.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.KnownAttributeKey.AllowedTypes
member.summary: Indicates additional restrictions on the allowed type.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.KnownAttributeKey.AllowParent
member.summary: Indicates that the component that owns the property is a valid value (by default it is not).

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.KnownAttributeKey.ValueFilter
member.summary: Specifies a regular expression used to verify the property value (converted to a string).

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.KnownAttributeKey.Quantity
member.summary: Indicates the quantity that a numeric property represents.
member.remarks: Value must be a member of the enumeration.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.KnownAttributeKey.AutoApply
member.summary: Indicates that the property value should be applied immediately when it is changed in the GUI, rather than when the user clicks "Apply" or equivalent.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.KnownAttributeKey.Slider
member.summary: Indicates that a numeric property should be displayed as a slider.
member.remarks: Requires that MinValue and MaxValue are also set.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.KnownAttributeKey.AddToDisplayName
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the property should be added to the DisplayName of the parent component.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.KnownAttributeKey.DisplayValues
member.summary: Indicates alternative display values for a property. Value must be a list delimited by semicolons with the same number of elements as the AllowedValues attribute.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.KnownAttributeKey.VectorUsage
member.summary: Indicates the usage of a Vector3 property. Valid values are Position and Direction.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Material.Ambient
member.summary: Gets or sets the ambient color component. The ambient color is applied uniformly to an object regardless of light and view direction.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Material.Diffuse
member.summary: Gets or sets the diffuse color component. The diffuse color represents the light reflected from a matte surface.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Material.Specular
member.summary: Gets or sets the specular color component. The specular color represents the shiny effect resulting from a reflective surface.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Material.Emissive
member.summary: Gets or sets the emissive color component. It behaves similar to the ambient color, except it is independent of the color of the light source.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Material.Shininess
member.summary: Gets or sets the coefficent for specular lighting. It affects the tightness of the specular highlight. The value has to be between 0 and 128. The default value is 30.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Material.BaseTexture
member.summary: Gets or sets the base color texture.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Material.TextureSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a desired width and height, in meters, of the base texture and normal map when applied to a surface.
member.remarks: If TextureSize is nonzero, the texture coordinates of the surface will be modified when this Material is applied. TBD: Limitations

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Material.TextureLuminosity
member.summary: Gets or sets the luminosity of the base texture, which defines how the texture is lighted.
member.remarks: A value of 0 (default) means that the texture brightness is defined only by the diffuse lighting of the surface, while 1 means the texture is entirely luminous. If is Modulate, this property is ignored.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Material.Blend
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the result of the color properties (ambient, diffuse, specular, emissive, shininess) should be blended with the texture-based effects.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Material.BlendMode
member.summary: Gets or sets how the result of the color properties (ambient, diffuse, specular, emissive, shininess) should be blended with the texture-based effects.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Material.EnvironmentMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the environment map texture. The environment map is used to simulate a reflective surface. The texture in the environment map will be reflected by the surface it is applied to.
member.remarks: Both sphere and cube map textures are supported. Requires advanced lighting.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Material.NormalMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the normal map texture. The normal map contains perturbations of the surface normal encoded as RGB values. It is used by the various bump mapping effects.
member.remarks: Requires advanced lighting.

member.summary: Specifies and offset and rotation for the textures

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Mechanism.CalculateInverseKinematics(ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.RsTarget,ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.RsToolData,System.Boolean,System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Calculates inverse kinematics for the mechanism. Given the specified and , this method returns the joint values the mechanism would have if it was moved to the pose. A mechanism can often reach the specified pose with different arm configurations. Using the useConfiguration you force the arm configuration stored in the RsTarget to be used.
member.param: The target position. This is the position that shall coincide with the tool.
The tool that should coincide with the target. The RobotHold property is used to determince if the tool is stationary or held by the robot.

Specifies if the exact arm configuration stored in the target shall be used for the calculation. If set to true, the arm configuration is used. In this case this method returns true only if the mechanism can move to the specified target with its specified arm configuration. If the parameter is set to false, the arm configuration that is closes to the current mechanism joint values is returned, if the target is reachable.
Out parameter that contains the joint values, the mechanism would have if it was moved to the target position. If this method returns false, the joint values are undefined.
member.returns: True, if the mechanism can move to the target position, otherwise false.
member.remarks: When using this overload the target position shall not be converted to to mechanism base frame coordinates.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Mechanism.CalculateInverseKinematics(ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.RsRobTarget,ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.RsWorkObject,ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.RsToolData,System.Int32[],System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Calculates inverse kinematics for the mechanism given a , and .
member.param: Out parameter that contains the joint values, the mechanism would have if it was moved to the target position. If this method returns false, the joint values are undefined.
member.returns: True, if the mechanism can move to the target position, otherwise false.

member.param: The target position. This is the position that shall coincide with the tool.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Mechanism.GetAllConfigurationsAsync(ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.RsTarget,ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.RsToolData,System.Int32[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns reachable arm configurations for the specified target.
member.param: The target for which to find reachable configurations.
The tool that should coincide with the target. The RobotHold property is used to determince if the tool is stationary or held by the robot.

An array of integers which specifies Cfx values to be included in the resulting array. This parameter is only applicable for a bending bacwards robot. Cfx values which are not specified in the filter will not be considered, which will improve performance. Often you know that you are only interested in configurations where, for example, the wrist is in front of axis 1. , forRobotHold property is used to determince if the tool is stationary or held by the robot.
Only the base configurations will be returned if this parameter is set to false. If true, the turns of the base configurations will be added.
member.returns: An array of with which the mechanism can reach the specified target.

member.summary: Sets the defined sync position in form of a collection of values. The number of values are 0-6 depending on the number of joints used for the mechanism beeing built.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.MechanismBuilder.SetJointMask(System.Int32[])
member.summary: This method sets a mask that defines which joints that are used for mechanism being built. The mask is specified as an array of integers. The length of the array must be between 6 and 12. Each element specifies if the corresponding axis is used or not. The value 0 means not used and the value 1 means used. For example the array {1,1,1,1,0,1} means that all axis except axis 5 are used.
member.param: An array of integers with mask values that specifies if a joint with the same number as the position in the array is used or not.

member.summary: Sets an expression to calculate a joints value that depend on other joint values.
member.param: A name to identify the joint.
A string containig an expression.

member.summary: When all data, Links, Joints etc. are set to the modeler call CompileMechanism.

member.summary: Loads a part from file.
member.param: Specifies the file to load.
A delegate of type that receives notifications about the progress of the load operation.
If true, backfacing surfaces will not be culled when the part is rendered.
Controls whether hidden entities are translated or discarded when importing a non-Acis CAD file.
Controls whether an attempt is made to automatically heal geometric entitites.
Specifies the detail level(s) to use when creating the graphical representation of geometric entities.
member.returns: The loaded Part, or null if the file was loaded successfully but no valid entities were found.
member.remarks: Supported file formats are Acis (.sat) and other CAD file formats that have a valid license. Also supports visualization formats such as VRML, STL, JT, 3DS and PLY.
member.exception: Failed to acquire a valid license for the specified file format.
Failed to load the file. The exception object contains a description of the problem.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.RobotAxisValues.SetAxisValues(ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.RobotAxisValues@,System.Double[],System.Int32[])
member.summary: Sets only the values of the active axes. One array contains the values for the active axes, and another arrays specifies the position in the , where the values will be set. This method is used when setting axes values for robots that has less than 6 axes.
member.param: The which values shall be set. Which axes (Rax_1 - Rax_6), that will be affected depends on activeJoints.
An array of double that contains the values to set.
An array of int that specifies in which positions (Rax_1 to Rax_6) the values shall be set.
member.exception: The different reasons are: The axisValue is not of the same length as the activeJoints array. The arrays have a length that is not between 1 and 6. The values in the activeJoints array are not in the range 1 to 6. Since they are used to define which values from Rax_1 to Rax_6 that are set, it must be in the range 1 to 6.

member.summary: Sets the values of the specified , given the specified array of doubles.
member.exception: The axisValue array is not of length 6.
member.remarks: The length of axisValues must be 6.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.RsJointTarget.JumpTo(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Jumps the mechanism of the task that the jointtraget belongs to, to the position of the jointtarget. Optionally updates the joint values in the virtual controller. Updating the joint values in the controller is time consuning compared to only updating the joint value. If you need to frequently call this method, it is recomended to update the joint values in the controller, only for the last call.
member.param: Specifies if the joint values in the controller shall be updated in addition to the joint values of the mechanism.
member.returns: True if it is possible to jump to the target and the jump succeded, otherwise false.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.RsJointTarget.JumpTo
member.summary: Jumps the mechanism of the task that the jointtraget belongs to, to the position of the jointtarget.
member.returns: True if it is possible to jump to the target and the jump succeded, otherwise false.

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.RsLoadData
member.summary: Loaddata is used to describe loads attached to the mechanical interface of the robot Load data usually defines the payload (grip load is defined by the instruction Grip- Load) of the robot, i.e. the load held in the robot gripper. The tool load is specified in the tool data (tooldata) which includes load data.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.RsLoadData.#ctor(System.Double,ABB.Robotics.Math.Vector3,ABB.Robotics.Math.Quaternion,ABB.Robotics.Math.Vector3)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance with the specified parameters.
member.param: The weight of the load.
The centre of gravity of a tool load expressed in the wrist coordinate system.
The orientation of the coordinate system defined by the inertial axes of the tool load.
The moment of inertia of the load around the x-, y- and z-axis of the tool load or payload coordinate system.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.RsLoadData.Mass
member.summary: Gets or Sets the weight of the load.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.RsLoadData.Cog
member.summary: The centre of gravity of a tool load expressed in the wrist coordinate system. If a stationary tool is used, it means the centre of gravity for the tool holding the work object.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.RsLoadData.Aom
member.summary: The orientation of the coordinate system defined by the inertial axes of the tool load. Expressed in the wrist coordinate system as a quaternion (q1, q2, q3, q4). If a stationary tool is used, it means the inertial axes for the tool holding the work object.
member.remarks: The orientation of the tool load coordinate system must coincide with the orientation of the wrist coordinate system. It must always be set to 1, 0, 0, 0.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.RsLoadData.Inertia
member.summary: The moment of inertia of the load around the x-, y- and z-axis of the tool load or payload coordinate system.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.RsMoveInstruction.JumpTo(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Jumps the mechanism, of corresponding task, to the position of the move instruction. Optionally updates the joint values in the virtual controller. Updating the joint values in the controller is time consuning compared to only updating the joint value. If you need to frequently call this method, it is recomended to update the joint values in the controller, only for the last call.
member.param: Specifies if the joint values in the controller shall be updated in addition to the joint values of the mechanism.
member.returns: True if the operation is successfull, otherwise false.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.RsMoveInstruction.JumpTo
member.summary: Jumps the mechanism, of corresponding task, to the position of the move instruction
member.returns: True if the operation is successfull, otherwise false.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.RsMoveInstruction.MoveToAsync(System.Collections.Generic.List{ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.SyncLogMessage})
member.summary: Moves the mechanism, of corresponding task, to the position of the move- instruction using its settings. A temporary RAPID program is created on the controller and is executed. The temporary RAPID program is created by using RapidSync. The synchronization log is returned from this overload.
member.param: The list of log messages from the underlying RapidSync operation.
member.returns: True if the operation succeeded, false if there was an error executing the RAPID program. Any other error will raise an exception.

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.RsWorkObject
member.summary: A workobject is a coordinate system used to describe the position of a work piece. The workobject consists of two frames: a user frame and an object frame. It corresponds to the 'workobject' data type in RAPID.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Stations.Wire.GetSection(ABB.Robotics.Math.Vector3,ABB.Robotics.Math.Vector3[])
member.summary: Returns a section of the supplied wire, that is limited by two vertices of the wire. The edges that are contained in the section are returned. If test positions are supplied, the section will be limited by by one or two of them, if they can be found on the section and makes a smaller section. A section is determined as being a closed or open curvature that does not contain any branches - vertices that are connected to more than two edges must limit a section!
member.returns: The section found, or null.
member.param: The point on curve to receive the length to.
The test points.
member.remarks: This version ignores testPoints and simply returns the coordinates of the vertices that limits the section.

member.name: M:RobotStudio.API.Internal.YumiKinematics.GetMultiAxisRobotArmAngle(RobotStudio.API.Internal.YumiData,RobotStudio.API.Internal.RobotGravityParameters,System.Double[],System.Int32@,System.Double@)
member.summary:
GetMultiAxisRobotArmAngle - calculates the arm angle (aka configuration angle)
Given the tcp and elbow position, this function computes the arm angle. This angle is the angle formed between the plane defined by the shoulder, elbow and tcp and the plane aligned with a reference direction and passing through the shoulder and the tcp.
ERROR if the position is singular with respect to the arm-angle, which happens if: 1) The TCP position is close to zero 2) The arm is fully stretched, that is, p_length is zero 3) The reference plane is undefined, that is, d_length is zero
The reference direction is currently hard-coded to coincide with axis 1, but itshould be CFG parameter that the user can decide.
